001package org.consensusj.rx.zeromq;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.BackpressureStrategy;
004import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
005import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.FlowableEmitter;
006import org.reactivestreams.Publisher;
007import org.slf4j.Logger;
008import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
009import org.zeromq.ZMQ;
010import org.zeromq.ZMQException;
011import org.zeromq.ZMsg;
012import zmq.ZError;
013
014import java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory;
015
016// TODO: Consider a mechanism to configure backpressure strategy without using RxJava 3. Is there a need?
017/**
018 *  Factory class for creating {@code Publisher<ZMsg>} from a {@link ZMQ.Socket}. The created {@link Publisher}
019 *  will receive a multiplexed stream of {@link ZMsg} (i.e. {@code ZMsg} for all topics.) Typically
020 *  these multiplexed {@code Publisher<ZMsg>} are created by a {@link RxZmqContext} which also de-multiplexes them.
021 *  <p>
022 *  TODO: Write some tests!!
023 */
024public class ZMsgSocketFlowable {
025    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ZMsgSocketFlowable.class);
026    private static final ThreadFactory defaultThreadFactory = runnable -> new Thread(runnable, "ZeroMQ Receiver");
027
028    static Publisher<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket) {
029        return createFromSocket(socket, defaultThreadFactory);
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * @deprecated Use {@link #createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket)}
034     */
035    @Deprecated
036    static Publisher<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket, BackpressureStrategy backpressureStrategy) {
037        return createFromSocket(socket, backpressureStrategy, defaultThreadFactory);
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * The created {@link Flowable} will create a new receiving loop thread per subscriber, which may
042     * not be what you want. To support multiple subscribers use {@link RxZmqContext}, or something
043     * similar, or directly use a {@link io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.FlowableProcessor}
044     * <p>
045     *     Note: {@code BackpressureStrategy.LATEST} is hard-coded internally
046     * 
047     * @param socket A connected socket, ready to receive messages with {@link ZMsg#recvMsg(ZMQ.Socket)}
048     * @param threadFactory used to create the thread that runs the receive loop
049     * @return A "cold" Flowable
050     */
051    static Publisher<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket, ThreadFactory threadFactory) {
052        return Flowable.create(emitter -> {
053            Thread thread = threadFactory.newThread(new ZmqReceiveLoop(socket, emitter));
054            thread.start();
055            emitter.setCancellable(() -> {
056                thread.interrupt();
057                thread.join();
058            });
059        }, BackpressureStrategy.LATEST);
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * @deprecated Use {@link #createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket, ThreadFactory)}
064     */
065    @Deprecated
066    static Publisher<ZMsg> createFromSocket(ZMQ.Socket socket, BackpressureStrategy backpressureStrategy, ThreadFactory threadFactory) {
067        return Flowable.create(emitter -> {
068            Thread thread = threadFactory.newThread(new ZmqReceiveLoop(socket, emitter));
069            thread.start();
070            emitter.setCancellable(() -> {
071                thread.interrupt();
072                thread.join();
073            });
074        }, backpressureStrategy);
075    }
076
077
078    /**
079     * A runnable {@link ZMQ.Socket} receive loop that can be cancelled with {@link Thread#interrupt}
080     * and sends messages and errors to the supplied {@link FlowableEmitter}.
081     */
082    private static class ZmqReceiveLoop implements Runnable {
083        private final ZMQ.Socket socket;
084        private final FlowableEmitter<ZMsg> emitter;
085
086        /**
087         * @param socket A connected socket, ready to receive messages with {@link ZMsg#recvMsg(ZMQ.Socket)}
088         * @param emitter should be supplied by {link @Flowable#create}
089         */
090        private ZmqReceiveLoop(ZMQ.Socket socket, FlowableEmitter<ZMsg> emitter) {
091            this.socket = socket;
092            this.emitter = emitter;
093        }
094
095        @Override
096        public void run() {
097            log.info("Starting receiving thread.");
098            while (!Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted()) {
099                try {
100                    ZMsg message = ZMsg.recvMsg(socket);
101                    if (message != null) {
102                        emitter.onNext(message);
103                    }
104                } catch (Exception e) {
105                    if (e instanceof ZMQException && ((ZMQException) e).getErrorCode() == ZError.ETERM) {
106                        log.info("Got ZError.ETERM");
107                        // Is this the error we get when upstream closes the channel?
108                        emitter.onComplete();
109                    } else if (e instanceof ZMQException && ((ZMQException) e).getErrorCode() == ZError.EINTR) {
110                        log.info("Ignoring ZError.EINTR");
111                        // Should we send an onComplete when we are cancelled?
112                        emitter.onComplete();
113                    } else {
114                        log.error("Exception: ", e);
115                        emitter.onError(e);
116                    }
117                    break;
118                }
119            }
120            log.info("Closing ZMQ.Socket.");
121            socket.setLinger(0);
122            socket.close();
123        }
124    }
125}
